name: react-bloomer-snippets

0.1.0.name: react-bloomer-snippets
0.1.0.description: An Atom snippets library for Bloomer (Bulma for React).

readme:
React Bloomer Snippets for Atom [![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/awles/react-bloomer-snippets.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/awles/react-bloomer-snippets)
====================================================================================================================================================================

An [Atom](https://atom.io/) snippets library for Bloomer (Bulma components for React).
Thanks to [AlgusDark](https://github.com/AlgusDark) for [Bloomer](https://github.com/AlgusDark/bloomer).

Install
-------

Go to `Packages > Settings View > Open` once in settings go to the Install tab and search for **react-bloomer-snippets**

Restart Atom

Development
-----------

```sh
$ cd ~/.atom/packages
$ git clone https://github.com/awles/react-bloomer-snippets.git
$ cd react-bloomer-snippets
$ apm install
$ apm link
```

Snippets
--------

1. `TagName` will render in `<TagName prop={'value'}></<TagName>`
2. `_TagName` will render in `import { TagName, TagName } from 'bloomer'`
3. `isProp` will render in `isProp={'value'}`
4. `0` will render in `={''}`

Test it out, there are all the components on [Bloomer](https://bloomer.js.org)

Contributing
------------

1.	Fork it
2.	Create your feature branch: `git checkout -b my-new-feature`
3.	Commit your changes: `git commit -m 'Add some feature'`
4.	Push to the branch: `git push origin my-new-feature`
5.	Submit a pull request
